articles.title: Biden cancels $10000 in student loan debts - BBC
articles.description: Americans to get $10,000 in student debt cancelled if they earn $125,000 or less, US President Joe Biden announces.
articles.content:
US President Joe Biden will cancel up to $10,000 (£8,474) in federal student loans for millions of Americans who earn less than $125,000 each year. 
Mr Biden will also forgive $20,000 of debt for st… [+1993 chars]

articles.title: Big Relief For American Express In India, Can Sign Up New Card Users - NDTV Profit
articles.description: The RBI had imposed curbs on American Express Banking Corp for not following its new ruled on "Storage of Payment System Data" in May last year.
articles.content:
American Express has now been found compliant of the RBI's rules.
New Delhi: The Reserve Bank on Wednesday lifted the restrictions on American Express Banking Corp and allowed onboarding of new dome… [+1099 chars]

articles.title: Eric Nam to perform in Singapore in November for There And Back Again world tour - Channel NewsAsia
articles.description: The Korean-American singer-songwriter will be performing at Gateway Theatre on Nov 14.
articles.content:
Korean-American singer-songwriter Eric Nam announced on Wednesday (Aug 24) that he will perform in Singapore on Nov 14 as part of his There And Back Again world tour.

articles.title: The most popular Android phone in North America might be unexpected - Android Authority
articles.description: A market share report shows iPhones dominated the list of most popular phones in North America, but Samsung had two flagships on the list.
articles.content:
• Samsungs Galaxy S22 Ultra was reportedly the most popular Android phone in North America in Q2.

articles.author: Brenda Goodman, CNN
articles.title: Americans are highly vaccinated against polio. Here's why it could still spread - CNN
articles.description: So far, there's been just one recent case of polio in the United States, which paralyzed a young adult in Rockland County, New York.
articles.content:
(CNN)So far, there's been just one recent case of polio in the United States, which paralyzed a young adult in Rockland County, New York.
